key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel maintains high price consistency with Icelandair's website, showing alignment over 85% across various dimensions despite rising omissions.
MSE channel often undercuts Icelandair's website prices on 88.16% of itineraries but faces a decline in lower price frequency.
GDS exhibits strong price parity with the website, achieving 87.50% price alignment, though there's an uptick in unavailable offers.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels. It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Most OTA prices are aligned with Icelandair's web offers, maintaining over 85% consistency in the last week for both short and long hauls.
The OTA channel rarely offers lower prices than Icelandair, with instances nearly non-existent across all dimensions.
A rising trend in offers not appearing on OTA, up 6-9% in the last week, affects both short and long haul flights.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The proportion of offers not available on the OTA has increased both weekly and monthly across all dimensions.
About 87% of OTA prices match Icelandair's website consistently over the last month, indicating strong alignment.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: The OTA channel aligns 85% of its prices with Icelandair's for short-haul flights, showing slight dips compared to the previous month.
Long-haul itineraries see a 92% match rate with Icelandair's offers, with little variation week-over-week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Iceland-origin point of origin, 82% of offers match on OTA, but a continued rise in offers not found by 15.9% over the month is noted.
For non-Iceland origin, the match rate is 97%, indicating firm consistency with Icelandair's site.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Booking close-in windows show 85% price alignment on OTA, with a mild shift of non-appearing offers up by 13% monthly.
Far-out bookings have a high stable match rate of 95%, with minimal variances frequently across months.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE channel predominantly offers lower prices with 88.16% of itineraries cheaper than the airline's website.
Frequency of lower prices in MSE reduced by 5.31% from the previous week and 9.84% from the previous month.
No occurrences of MSE channel pricing higher than the airline's website across all dimensions.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 88.16% of prices on MSE are lower compared to the airline's website, with a slight frequency reduction over time.
11.84% of website offers not found on the MSE channel, showing an upward trend.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul itineraries show 85.58% of prices lower on MSE, but with a reduction from prior periods.
Long haul itineraries maintain 91.84% lower prices with less fluctuation.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Originating from Iceland shows 81.91% of itineraries are cheaper on MSE, with a notable decrease in lower price frequency.
Non-Iceland origins consistently show high MSE advantage with nearly all moments priced lower compared to the website.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings are cheaper 85.05% of the time, but face significant declines in lower price frequency.
Far-out bookings have 95.56% lower MSE prices, with minimal fluctuations over time.

gds_highlights.line_content: The frequency of GDS matches with website prices stands high across all dimensions, indicating strong price parity.
Instances where GDS prices are lower than website offers are rare, with slight frequency increases from the previous periods.
No recorded cases of higher pricing on GDS compared to the airline website, showcasing competitive pricing stability.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Approximately 11.84% of offers were unavailable on the GDS last week, a significant increase from the prior trends.
GDS and website pricing were the same for 87.50% of cases last week, a slight decrease reflecting increased GDS N/A cases.
Instances of the GDS offering lower rates were negligible at 0.66%, with a slight increase over previous rates but marginal overall.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 84.47% of short haul routes last week showed price parity between GDS and the website, though fewer than in previous periods.
Long haul routes experienced strong price alignment with 91.84% parity, only slightly declining from prior periods regarding matches.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes originating in Iceland have a higher percentage (18.09%) of GDS N/A occurrences compared to Non-IS routes.
Non-Icelandic origin routes show extraordinary parity at 98.28% same-pricing, accentuating consistency across these routes.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries reflected significant parity at 84.11%, despite a marked uptick in GDS N/A incidents.
Far-out bookings manifest strong parity with a 93.33% match, maintaining reliable alignment over extended periods.
